column4: Kubuntu/Xubuntu  and ubuntu, is there really a big diffrence of the three? I heard that one of those versions could help my issue and I do not need to blow away my system to one, just add the extra packages
They're the same under the surface, but have different look and feel.
If you've got one installed, installing another is easy
Just do: sudo aptitude install kubuntu-desktop (or whatever version), then you can choose your flavour at boot-up time
Thank you. I heard that those two do not use pulseaudio and that could be causing my audio problems. I have nothing going on tonight and this drive is a linux test for me to learn anyhow hehe
good luck! They're all good versions - I hope you find one that works for you
When I used to use Kubuntu, I did without pulseaudio, although it was there as an option.
Thanks again, I'll try and install one. just have to decide on xubuntu or kubuntu.. Something easy since I'm a noob lol
Overall, you'll find xubuntu simpler. KDE is great, but much more customizable and fiddly, I'd say
like making menus melt when you close them Bede? lol
Ha! No, I like Compiz for that. I used Kubuntu for about a year and loved it, but I'd certainly start with gnome or XFCE if you're quite new to linux

Yes, that's right. Many people use it with Gnome. Gnome can be a little heavy on resources; if you have a problem with that then you'll probably like XFCE
